titleStmt.title: Good and bad newes from Jreland in a letter of credit from Youghall not forged as are most pamphlets lately published : the particulars are these : the good newes, the relieving of Youghall by Sir Charles Vavasor, the defeate of 800 rebels at Bandenbridge by my Lord of Kilmeakell, the reliefe of Corke by my lord president of Munster : the bad newes, the revolt of Waterford and Lymericke, and the losse of the Castle of Piltowne, which castle put Sir Charles Vavasor to a hard taske to relieve Youghall.
titleStmt.author: Gibbes, James.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
